description: From Middle English pultes, from Latin pultes, plural of puls. The phonological development from Middle English is regular; compare poultry.

entries.meaning: A soft, moist mass, usually wrapped in cloth and warmed, that is applied topically to a sore, aching or lesioned part of the body to soothe it.
A porous solid filled with solvent, used to remove stains from porous stone such as marble or granite.

verbs.description: poultice (third-person singular simple present poultices, present participle poulticing, simple past and past participle poulticed)
